title: Longer periods, fewer subjects, extended school days
byline: The Education Ministry announced that under the new education reforms for Grades 1 to 6, starting next year, the duration of each subject period will be increased to 50 minutes, while the number of subject periods will be reduced to seven, and the school day extended to 2 p.m., Education Ministry Secretary Nalaka Kaluwewa said.

title: Former President appears before Bribery Commission
byline: Former President Maithripala Sirisena appeared before the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) to provide a statement this morning.

title: Principal suspended after drug arrest
byline: The North Central Provincial Education Director has decided to suspend the principal who was arrested with a large stock of heroin.

title: Plastic loops in main canals, waterways in Colombo to prevent blocking on rainy days
byline: Plans have been afoot to implement a project under the Clean Sri Lanka Initiative to erect plastic loops in main canals and waterways in Colombo city to collect plastic and polythene as a solution to the blocking of waterways on rainy days.

title: Elon Musk’s $1tn pay deal approved by Tesla shareholders
byline: Tesla boss Elon Musk has had a record-breaking pay package that could be worth nearly $1tn (£760bn) approved by shareholders.

title: CEB plans solar-powered EV charging stations with incentive tariffs
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) is set to introduce a new project to install Electric Vehicle (EV) charging stations that will utilize excess solar energy generated across the country, while offering fast-charging facilities with an incentive tariff, CEB Deputy General Manager (Business & Operational Strategy) Noel Priyantha said.

title: Hype of activities in P’ment for budget
byline: Hype of activities were witnessed in the Parliamentary complex yesterday with cleaning and colour washing for the budget which is to be presented today.

title: Sri Lanka starts work on national plan to improve care system
byline: Sri Lanka has begun the first steps to build a stronger and fairer care system to better support families, workers, and communities. The move comes as the country faces a fast-growing older population and a rising need for quality care services.

title: Tourist on bicycle has narrow shave with leopard
byline: A tourist riding on bicycle along the Galge road in Buttala who ignored the advise of a tourist guide transporting a tourist couple, to be cautious of wild elephants and leopards frequenting the road had encountered a leopard within a short distance.

title: MRIA’s operations cost 14 times higher than income in 2024
byline: The Mattala Rajapaksa International Airport (MRIA) has recorded an operating cost of Rs. 3,600.8 million, nearly 14 times higher than its operating income of Rs. 242 million, the 2024 audit of Airport and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) (Private) Limited (AASL) revealed.

title: 2026 budget attuned to IMF programme to be unveiled today
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake will present his government’s budget for 2026 in Parliament today, the second by him upon election to office, and it is expected to be aligned with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) economic reform agenda.

title: Three Sri Lankans attacked in chemical assaults in Israel
byline: Three Sri Lankan nationals who were attacked have reported their experiences to the Sri Lankan Embassy in Israel, following a series of chemical-laced water cannon assaults targeting foreign migrant workers.

title: Suresh Raina, Shikhar Dhawan’s assets worth Rs 11 crore attached in betting app case
byline: The Directorate of Enforcement (ED) has attached assets worth Rs 11.14 crore belonging to former Indian cricketers Suresh Raina and Shikhar Dhawan in connection with the investigation into betting platforms.

title: Sri Lankan pleads guilty, gets life for Ottawa family murders
byline: The Sri Lankan man who pleaded guilty to killing a mother, her four children and a family friend in a gruesome mass stabbing in an Ottawa suburb in 2024 has been sentenced to life in prison without the possibility of parole for 25 years.

title: Mexico’s President Sheinbaum takes legal action after groping incident
byline: Mexico’s President Claudia Sheinbaum is pressing charges against a man who she said was “drunk” and harassed her on Tuesday, calling the incident “an assault on all women.”

title: Justice S. Thurairaja sworn in as Acting Chief Justice
byline: Supreme Court Justice S. Thurairaja was sworn in as the Acting Chief Justice before President Anura Kumara Dissanayake at the Presidential Secretariat today (07).

title: Mahinda Rajapaksa will not attend opposition rally: Namal
byline: Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa said that former President Mahinda Rajapaksa will not take part in the opposition protest rally scheduled to be held in Nugegoda on November 21.

title: Police Canine Division on standby to assist school-level drug inspections
byline: The Police Official Canine Division is on standby to assist school-level drug inspections if requested by the principals of schools, Police said.

title: Liquor store sealed for selling alcohol on Poya Day
byline: A retail liquor store (Excise RB 04) in Ja-Ela has been sealed by excise officers for selling alcohol on Poya Day, in violation of excise regulations.

title: Cabinet approves 2026 budget
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers approved the budget for 2026, the Government Information Department said.

title: AI-powered chatbot introduced to strengthen vocational education support
byline: The Ministry of Education, Higher Education, and Vocational Education has introduced an Artificial Intelligence (AI)-powered chatbot to make vocational education information more accessible to students.

title: Elon Musk’s $1tn pay deal approved by Tesla shareholders
byline: Tesla boss Elon Musk has had a record-breaking pay package that could be worth nearly $1tn (£760bn) approved by shareholders.

title: Suresh Raina, Shikhar Dhawan’s assets worth Rs 11 crore attached in betting app case
byline: The Directorate of Enforcement (ED) has attached assets worth Rs 11.14 crore belonging to former Indian cricketers Suresh Raina and Shikhar Dhawan in connection with the investigation into betting platforms.

title: Three candidates qualify as voting begins to elect new Diyawadana Nilame
byline: Voting to elect the new Diyawadana Nilame (lay custodian) of the Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic in Kandy began, with only three candidates qualifying to contest.

title: Rs. 2,000 Million proposed to support rural bus services
byline: The 2026 budget proposal includes an allocation of Rs. 2,000 million to support the continuation of essential bus services in areas where passengers face hardships due to reduced operations.

title: Rs. 1,000 million allocated for new drinking water projects
byline: The government has allocated Rs. 1,000 million to address urban and rural drinking water needs across the country.

title: Mahapola Scholarship to be increased
byline: Presenting the 2026 Budget in Parliament, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said that the Mahapola Scholarship will be increased by Rs. 2,500, bringing the total monthly allowance to Rs. 10,000.

title: The Budget summary so far
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is currently presenting the Budget 2026 in Parliament, unveiling a series of allocations and reforms focused on economic stability, healthcare, digital transformation, and social welfare.

title: Government steps up measures to reduce human-elephant conflict
byline: Sri Lanka continues to face a severe Human-Elephant Conflict, resulting in the loss of approximately 80 human lives and over 260 elephants annually.

title: Estate workers’ daily wage to increase by January 2026
byline: The daily wage for estate workers will be increased from Rs. 1,350 to Rs. 1,750 by January 2026.

title: First digital ID card to be issued by March 2026
byline: Presenting the 2026 Budget in Parliament today, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake announced that Sri Lanka’s first digital national identity card will be issued by March 2026.

title: President claiming credit for PFM Act: Harsha
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is claiming credit for the change in economic management brought about through the Public Financial Management Act, which was introduced in early 2024, Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Harsha de Silva said.

title: Nine top organised criminals behind Ganemulla Sanjeewa’s murder plot, CID reveals to court
byline: The Colombo Crimes Division (CCD) today informed the Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama that nine prominent organised criminals were allegedly behind the plot to murder Ganemulla Sanjeewa.

title: Budget 2026; Inflation to be maintained below 5%
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake presnting the Budget - 2026 in Parliament, pledged to maintain inflation below 5 percent and accelerate the country’s post-crisis economic recovery.

title: US $ 1.3 billion spent on vehicle imports so far this year
byline: Sri Lanka has spent US $ 1.3 billion on vehicle imports by October 31, this year, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said.

title: 7 Percent Growth Targeted – President
byline: “The government is working with the target of achieving 7 percent economic growth,” President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said.

title: Sri Lanka records US$ 823 million in FDI by September – President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said that Sri Lanka has achieved US$ 823 million in Foreign Direct Investments (FDI) by September this year.

title: SriLankan Airlines debt  to be restructured this year: President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said the US $ 210 million debt component of SriLankan Airlines would be restructured this year.

title: Over 200 flights delayed at Delhi airport after glitch in air traffic system
byline: More than 200 flights were delayed at Delhi airport, one of the world’s busiest, after an air traffic control messaging system suffered a technical problem, India’s airport authority and a source familiar with the matter said on Friday.
